intro: Geranium clarum, commonly known as the clear geranium, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features upright stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the top of the plant. Geranium clarum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
